title: How to Make Scrambled Plantain

steps.headline: Pick out healthy plantains.
steps.description: You can choose to make use of ripe or unripe plantains. Mixing the two in equal portions will certainly taste great.

steps.headline: Peel off the skin of the plantains.
steps.description: Make 3 slits from top to the end of the plantains, and then take off the skin.

steps.headline: Chop the plantains into small chunks.
Cook them in salted water.
steps.description: They should be ready in 6 minutes or when you can run a fork through them.

steps.headline: Drain out the water and set aside plantains and water separately.
Chop your veggies and pan-fry in 5 tablespoons (73.9 ml) of vegetable or olive oil.
Add spices and a pinch of salt to your taste.
Pour in the plantains and stir.
Add a little bit of water from the cooked plantains and cook for 2 minutes to allow ingredients blend in well.
Serve hot with a glass of juice or just plain water.

text: Pick out healthy plantains. You can choose to make use of ripe or unripe plantains. Mixing the two in equal portions will certainly taste great. Peel off the skin of the plantains. Make 3 slits from top to the end of the plantains, and then take off the skin. Chop the plantains into small chunks.  Cook them in salted water. They should be ready in 6 minutes or when you can run a fork through them. Drain out the water and set aside plantains and water separately.  Chop your veggies and pan-fry in 5 tablespoons (73.9 ml) of vegetable or olive oil.  Add spices and a pinch of salt to your taste.  Pour in the plantains and stir.  Add a little bit of water from the cooked plantains and cook for 2 minutes to allow ingredients blend in well.  Serve hot with a glass of juice or just plain water.
